items.title: Live: Email to former Prince Andrew among millions of new 'Epstein Files' documents
items.description: More than 2,000 videos and 180,000 images have been released as part of the batch, which comes weeks after a legally mandated deadline signed by Donald Trump. Follow live.

items.title: Trump's foreign policy bluffs undermine each other
items.description: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

items.title: Phones to run hot all weekend as Ley's opponents near point of no return
items.description: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

items.title: Mohammed is one of ten children to die from cold in Gaza this winter
items.description: Mohammed died from hypothermia while in his mother's arms after a cold night in Gaza. His family are one of hundreds of thousands of Gazans enduring harsh winter conditions in flimsy tents across the enclave.

items.title: Djokovic hits out at critics after epic Australian Open win over Sinner
items.description: After beating two-time defending Jannik Sinner in five gruelling sets, Novak Djokovic sets his sights on those who doubted whether he could still be an Australian Open contender.

items.title: Deep in the desert a car graveyard offers a new vehicle for survival stories
items.description: The artists of Mimili, in the APY Lands of South Australia, are using new methods to share crucial knowledge of Country and culture, including repurposed car parts.

items.title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies
items.description: The Canadian-born actress died at her home in Los Angeles "following a brief illness", according to a statement from her agency.

items.title: Judge rules out death penalty for Mangione over healthcare CEO murder
items.description: A judge in Manhattan has thrown out federal murder and weapons charges the 27-year-old had faced, saying they are not legally compatible with the other charges of stalking he faces.

items.title: Push for retailers to play role in 3D-printed gun crackdown after Bondi attack
items.description: Retailers offering 3D printers or 3D printing services would report customers suspected of building 3D-printed guns to the authorities under fresh calls for corporate Australia to play a role in thwarting access to the deadly weapons.

items.title: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon arrested on charges related to anti-ICE protest
items.description: The arrest comes after Don Lemon live-streamed a demonstration that interrupted a church service in St Paul, Minnesota, earlier this month that protested President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in the area.

items.title: Djokovic turns back the clock to reach Aus Open final with marathon win over Sinner
items.description: Novak Djokovic will face Carlos Alcaraz in the Australian Open men's singles final after winning another epic semifinal against Jannik Sinner.

items.title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh as new Fed chair
items.description: Mr Warsh will replace current chair Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

items.title: More human remains, 'Celine Cremer's jacket' found in river search
items.description: More human remains and a jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker Celine Cremer have been found in a search of Tasmania's Arthur River, police say.

items.title: Gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante charged with family violence
items.description: Australian online gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante has appeared in a Perth court, accused of a slew of family violence, drugs and burglary offences.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: The US looks poised to strike Iran — but what is Trump's endgame?
items.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley
items.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: The NDIS was set up to relieve families. For some, it now does the opposite
items.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: These 10 albums from 1996 changed music forever
items.description: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. 30 years on, they still define the era.

items.title: Why your sunscreen application might be putting your good intentions to waste
items.description: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

items.title: 50C record for Port Augusta ahead of cool change
items.description: For the first time in four years, Australia has recorded temperatures in excess of 50C, with both locations in South Australia.

items.title: Bushfire-affected Victorian communities to get $160 million funding boost
items.description: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

items.title: Australia taking Nipah virus seriously but no changes to border control
items.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: Western nations decline to join 'Board of Peace' as Middle Eastern powers accept
items.description: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

items.title: Darwin Port deal 'true test' for Albanese as farmers fear more tariff pain
items.description: Industry groups that suffered three years of damaging Chinese trade tariffs on products including barley are appealing to the federal government to exercise careful diplomacy to defuse tensions with China over the ownership of Darwin Port.
